verses.verse: A soft answer turns back wrath, but a word of pain causes anger to go up.
The tongue of the wise makes glad knowledge, but the mouth of fools pours out foolishness.
The eyes of Jehovah are in every place watching the evil ones and the good ones.
A healing tongue is a tree of life, but perversity in it is a break of the spirit.
A fool despises his father's instruction, but he keeping correction is prudent.
In the house of the righteous ones is much treasure, but in the increase of the wicked one is troubling.
The lips of the wise ones disperse knowledge, but the heart of fools is not so.
The sacrifice of the wicked one is a disgusting thing to Jehovah, but the prayer of the upright one is His delight.
The way of the wicked ones is a disgusting thing to Jehovah, but He loves one pursuing righteousness.
Discipline is an evil thing to one leaving the path of obedience; one hating reproof shall die.
Sheol and destruction are before Jehovah; even more the hearts of the sons of men!
A scorner does not love one who corrects him; he will not go to the wise one.
A joyful heart makes a good face, but by pain of heart the spirit is stricken.
The heart of the discerning one seeks knowledge, but the mouth of fools feeds on folly.
All the days of the afflicted one are evil days, but a good heart is a continual feast.
Better is a little with the fear of Jehovah than great treasure and tumult with it.
Better is a meal of herbs and love than a fattened ox and hatred with it.
A man of fury stirs up strife, but one long to anger calms fighting.
The way of the lazy one is like a hedge of thorns, but the path of the upright ones is lifted up.
A wise son makes a glad father, but a man who is a fool despises his mother.
Foolishness is joy to him who lacks understanding, but a man of understanding directs his going.
Purposes without counsel are frustrated, but by many counselors they rise.
Joy is to a man by the answer of his mouth, and how good is a word in its time.
The path of life is upward to the prudent one, that he may turn away from Sheol below.
Jehovah will pull down the house of the proud ones, but He will set up the widow's border.
The thoughts of the evil one are disgusting things to Jehovah, but the sayings of pleasantness are pure.
One gaining unjust gain troubles his own house, but one hating bribes shall live.
The heart of the righteous one meditates how to answer, but the mouth of the wicked ones pours out evil.
Jehovah is far from the wicked ones, but He hears the prayer of the righteous ones.
The light of the eyes rejoices the heart, a good report makes the bones fat.
The ear that hears the reproof of life dwells in the midst of wisdom.
He casting off correction despises his own soul, but he who hears reproof gets heart.
The fear of Jehovah is instruction in wisdom, and before honor is humility.
